  129: -define(SLEEP, 500).
  130: -define(CORRECT_PASSWORD, "hello test").
  131: -define(INCORRECT_PASSWORD, "hello").
  132: -define(BADARG_PASSWORD, hello).

  134: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  135: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
  136: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  137: 
  138: all() ->
  139:     [
  140:      {group, 'tlsv1.3'},
  141:      {group, 'tlsv1.2'},
  142:      {group, 'tlsv1.1'},
  143:      {group, 'tlsv1'}
  144:     ].
  145: 
  146: groups() ->
  147:     [
  148:      {'tlsv1.3', [],  (api_tests() ++  [tls_13_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg,
  149:                                         tls_13_middlebox_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg]) -- [sockname]},
  150:      {'tlsv1.2', [],  api_tests()},
  151:      {'tlsv1.1', [],  api_tests()},
  152:      {'tlsv1', [],  api_tests()}
  153:     ].
  154: 
  155: api_tests() ->
  156:     [
  157:      tls_upgrade,
  158:      tls_upgrade_new_opts,
  159:      tls_upgrade_new_opts_with_sni_fun,
  160:      tls_upgrade_with_timeout,
  161:      tls_upgrade_with_client_timeout,
  162:      tls_downgrade,
  163:      tls_shutdown,
  164:      tls_shutdown_write,
  165:      tls_shutdown_both,
  166:      tls_shutdown_error,
  167:      tls_password_correct,
  168:      tls_password_incorrect,
  169:      tls_password_badarg,
  170:      tls_client_closes_socket,
  171:      tls_closed_in_active_once,
  172:      tls_reset_in_active_once,
  173:      tls_monitor_listener,
  174:      tls_tcp_msg,
  175:      tls_tcp_msg_big,
  176:      tls_dont_crash_on_handshake_garbage,
  177:      tls_tcp_error_propagation_in_active_mode,
  178:      tls_reject_warning_alert_in_initial_hs,
  179:      tls_reject_fake_warning_alert_in_initial_hs,
  180:      tls_app_data_in_initial_hs_state,
  181:      peername,
  182:      sockname,
  183:      tls_server_handshake_timeout,
  184:      transport_close,
  185:      transport_close_in_inital_hello,
  186:      emulated_options,
  187:      accept_pool,
  188:      reuseaddr
  189:     ].
  190: 
  191: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  192:     catch crypto:stop(),
  193:     try crypto:start() of
  194: 	ok ->
  195: 	    ssl_test_lib:clean_start(),
  196: 	    Config1 = ssl_test_lib:make_rsa_cert_with_protected_keyfile(Config0,
  197:                                                                         ?CORRECT_PASSWORD),
  198:             ssl_test_lib:make_dsa_cert(Config1)
  199:     catch _:_ ->
  200: 	    {skip, "Crypto did not start"}
  201:     end.
  202: 
  203: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  204:     ssl:stop(),
  205:     application:unload(ssl),
  206:     application:stop(crypto).
  207: 
  208: init_per_group(GroupName, Config) ->
  209:     ssl_test_lib:init_per_group(GroupName, Config).
  210: 
  211: end_per_group(GroupName, Config) ->
  212:   ssl_test_lib:end_per_group(GroupName, Config).
  213: 
  214: init_per_testcase(Testcase, Config) when Testcase == tls_server_handshake_timeout;
  215:                                          Testcase == tls_upgrade_with_timeout ->
  216:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  217:     Config;
  218: init_per_testcase(_, Config) ->
  219:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 5}),
  220:     Config.
  221: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  222:     Config.
  223: 
  224: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  225: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  226: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  227: tls_upgrade() ->
  228:     [{doc,"Test that you can upgrade an tcp connection to an ssl connection"}].
  229: 
  230: tls_upgrade(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  231:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  232:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  233:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  234:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  235: 
  236:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  237: 						{from, self()},
  238: 						{mfa, {?MODULE,
  239: 						       upgrade_result, []}},
  240: 						{tcp_options,
  241: 						 [{active, false} | TcpOpts]},
  242: 						{ssl_options, [{verify, verify_peer} | ServerOpts]}]),
  243:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  244:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_client([{node, ClientNode},
  245: 						{port, Port},
  246: 				   {host, Hostname},
  247: 				   {from, self()},
  248: 				   {mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result, []}},
  249: 				   {tcp_options, [binary]},
  250: 				   {ssl_options,  [{verify, verify_peer},
  251:                                                    {server_name_indication, Hostname} | ClientOpts]}]),
  252: 
  253:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  254: 
  255:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  256: 
  257:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  258:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  259: 
  260: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  261: tls_upgrade_new_opts() ->
  262:     [{doc,"Test that you can upgrade an tcp connection to an ssl connection and give new socket opts"}].
  263: 
  264: tls_upgrade_new_opts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  265:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  266:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  267:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  268:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  269: 
  270:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  271: 						{from, self()},
  272: 						{mfa, {?MODULE,
  273: 						       upgrade_result_new_opts, []}},
  274: 						{tcp_options,
  275: 						 [{active, false} | TcpOpts]},
  276: 						{ssl_options, [{verify, verify_peer},
  277:                                                                {mode, list} | ServerOpts]}]),
  278:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  279:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_client([{node, ClientNode},
  280: 						{port, Port},
  281: 				   {host, Hostname},
  282: 				   {from, self()},
  283: 				   {mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result_new_opts, []}},
  284: 				   {tcp_options, [binary]},
  285: 				   {ssl_options,  [{verify, verify_peer},
  286:                                                    {mode, list},
  287:                                                    {server_name_indication, Hostname} | ClientOpts]}]),
  288: 
  289:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  290: 
  291:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  292: 
  293:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  294:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  295: 
  296: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  297: tls_upgrade_new_opts_with_sni_fun() ->
  298:     [{doc,"Test that you can upgrade an tcp connection to an ssl connection with new versions option provided by sni_fun"}].
  299: 
  300: tls_upgrade_new_opts_with_sni_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  301:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  302:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  303:     ServerDsaOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_dsa_opts, Config),
  304:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  305:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  306:     Version = ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config),
  307:     NewVersions = new_versions(Version),
  308:     Ciphers =  ssl:filter_cipher_suites(ssl:cipher_suites(all, Version),
  309:                                         [{key_exchange, fun(srp_rsa) -> false;
  310:                                                            (srp_dss) -> false;
  311:                                                            (_) -> true
  312:                                                         end}]),
  313: 
  314:     NewOpts = [{versions, NewVersions},
  315:                {ciphers, Ciphers},
  316:                {verify, verify_peer}],
  317: 
  318:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server(
  319:                [{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  320:                 {from, self()},
  321:                 {mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result, []}},
  322:                 {tcp_options,
  323:                  [{active, false} | TcpOpts]},
  324:                 {ssl_options, [{versions, [Version |NewVersions]},
  325:                                {sni_fun, fun(_SNI) -> ServerOpts ++ NewOpts end}
  326:                               | ServerDsaOpts]}]),
  327:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  328:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_client(
  329:                [{node, ClientNode},
  330:                 {port, Port},
  331:                 {host, Hostname},
  332:                 {from, self()},
  333:                 {mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result, []}},
  334:                 {tcp_options, [binary]},
  335:                 {ssl_options,  [{versions,  [Version |NewVersions]},
  336:                                 {ciphers, Ciphers},
  337:                                 {server_name_indication, Hostname} | ClientOpts]}]),
  338: 
  339:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  340: 
  341:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  342: 
  343:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  344:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  345: 
  346: 
  347: 
  348: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  349: tls_upgrade_with_timeout() ->
  350:     [{doc,"Test handshake/3"}].
  351: 
  352: tls_upgrade_with_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  353:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  354:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  355:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  356:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  357: 
  358:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  359: 						{from, self()},
  360: 						{timeout, 5000},
  361: 						{mfa, {?MODULE,
  362: 						       upgrade_result, []}},
  363: 						{tcp_options,
  364: 						 [{active, false} | TcpOpts]},
  365: 						{ssl_options, [{verify, verify_peer} | ServerOpts]}]),
  366:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  367:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_client([{node, ClientNode},
  368: 						{port, Port},
  369: 						{host, Hostname},
  370: 						{from, self()},
  371: 						{mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result, []}},
  372: 						{tcp_options, TcpOpts},
  373: 						{ssl_options, [{verify, verify_peer},
  374:                                                                {server_name_indication, Hostname} | ClientOpts]}]),
  375: 
  376:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  377: 
  378:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  379: 
  380:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  381:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  382: 
  383: tls_upgrade_with_client_timeout() ->
  384:     [{doc,"Test upgrade with connect/3 and a timeout value"}].
  385: 
  386: tls_upgrade_with_client_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  387:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  388:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  389:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  390:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  391: 
  392:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  393: 						{from, self()},
  394: 						{mfa, {?MODULE,
  395: 						       upgrade_result, []}},
  396: 						{tcp_options,
  397: 						 [{active, false} | TcpOpts]},
  398: 						{ssl_options, [{verify, verify_peer} | ServerOpts]}]),
  399:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  400:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_client_error([{node, ClientNode},
  401: 						{port, Port},
  402: 				   {host, Hostname},
  403: 				   {from, self()},
  404:                                    {timeout, 0},
  405: 				   {mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result, []}},
  406: 				   {tcp_options, [binary]},
  407: 				   {ssl_options,  [{verify, verify_peer},
  408:                                                    {server_name_indication, Hostname} | ClientOpts]}]),
  409: 
  410:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p", [Client, Server]),
  411:     ok = ssl_test_lib:check_result(Client, {error, timeout}),
  412:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server).
  413: 
  414: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  415: tls_downgrade() ->
  416:       [{doc,"Test that you can downgarde an ssl connection to an tcp connection"}].
  417: tls_downgrade(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  418:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  419:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  420: 
  421:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  422: 
  423:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  424: 					{from, self()},
  425: 					{mfa, {?MODULE, tls_downgrade_result, [self()]}},
  426: 					{options, [{active, false}, {verify, verify_peer} | ServerOpts]}]),
  427:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  428:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  429: 					{host, Hostname},
  430: 					{from, self()},
  431: 					{mfa, {?MODULE, tls_downgrade_result, [self()]}},
  432: 					{options, [{active, false}, {verify, verify_peer} | ClientOpts]}]),
  433: 
  434:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ready, Client, ready),
  435: 
  436:     Server ! go,
  437:     Client ! go,
  438: 
  439:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  440:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  441:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  442: 
  443: 
  444: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  445: tls_shutdown() ->
  446:     [{doc,"Test API function ssl:shutdown/2"}].
  447: tls_shutdown(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  448:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  449:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  450:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  451:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  452: 					{from, self()},
  453: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_result, [server]}},
  454: 			   {options, [{exit_on_close, false},
  455: 				      {active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
  456:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  457:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  458: 					{host, Hostname},
  459: 					{from, self()},
  460: 					{mfa,
  461: 					 {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_result, [client]}},
  462: 					{options,
  463: 					 [{exit_on_close, false},
  464: 					  {active, false} | ClientOpts]}]),
  465: 
  466:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  467: 
  468:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  469:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  470: 
  471: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  472: tls_shutdown_write() ->
  473:     [{doc,"Test API function ssl:shutdown/2 with option write."}].
  474: tls_shutdown_write(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  475:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  476:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  477:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  478:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  479: 					{from, self()},
  480: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_write_result, [server]}},
  481: 			   {options, [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
  482:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  483:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  484: 					{host, Hostname},
  485: 			   {from, self()},
  486: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_write_result, [client]}},
  487: 			   {options, [{active, false} | ClientOpts]}]),
  488: 
  489:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, {error, closed}).
  490: 
  491: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  492: tls_shutdown_both() ->
  493:     [{doc,"Test API function ssl:shutdown/2 with option both."}].
  494: tls_shutdown_both(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  495:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  496:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  497:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  498:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  499: 					{from, self()},
  500: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_both_result, [server]}},
  501: 			   {options, [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
  502:     Port  = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  503:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  504: 					{host, Hostname},
  505: 			   {from, self()},
  506: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_both_result, [client]}},
  507: 			   {options, [{active, false} | ClientOpts]}]),
  508: 
  509:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, {error, closed}).
  510: 
  511: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  512: tls_shutdown_error() ->
  513:     [{doc,"Test ssl:shutdown/2 error handling"}].
  514: tls_shutdown_error(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  515:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  516:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(node()),
  517:     {ok, Listen} = ssl:listen(Port, ServerOpts),
  518:     {error, enotconn} = ssl:shutdown(Listen, read_write),
  519:     ok = ssl:close(Listen),
  520:     {error, closed} = ssl:shutdown(Listen, read_write).
  521: 
  522: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  523: tls_client_closes_socket() ->
  524:     [{doc,"Test what happens when client closes socket before handshake is completed"}].
  525: 
  526: tls_client_closes_socket(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  527:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  528:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  529:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  530: 
  531:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server_error([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  532: 						      {from, self()},
  533: 						      {tcp_options, TcpOpts},
  534: 						      {ssl_options, ServerOpts}]),
  535:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  536: 
  537:     Connect = fun() ->
  538: 		      {ok, _Socket} = rpc:call(ClientNode, gen_tcp, connect,
  539: 					      [Hostname, Port, [binary]]),
  540: 		      %% Make sure that handshake is called before
  541: 		      %% client process ends and closes socket.
  542: 		      ct:sleep(?SLEEP)
  543: 	      end,
  544: 
  545:     _Client = spawn_link(Connect),
  546: 
  547:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, {error,closed}).
  548: 
  549: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  550: tls_reset_in_active_once() ->
  551:     [{doc, "Test that ssl_closed is delivered in active once with non-empty buffer, check ERL-420."}].
  552: 
  553: tls_reset_in_active_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  554:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  555:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  556:     {_ClientNode, _ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  557:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  558:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(node()),
  559:     Server = fun() ->
  560: 		     {ok, Listen} = gen_tcp:listen(Port, TcpOpts),
  561: 		     {ok, TcpServerSocket} = gen_tcp:accept(Listen),
  562: 		     {ok, ServerSocket} = ssl:handshake(TcpServerSocket, ServerOpts),
  563: 		     lists:foreach(
  564: 		       fun(_) ->
  565: 			       ssl:send(ServerSocket, "some random message\r\n")
  566: 		       end, lists:seq(1, 20)),
  567: 		     %% Close TCP instead of SSL socket to trigger the bug:
  568: 		     gen_tcp:close(TcpServerSocket),
  569: 		     gen_tcp:close(Listen)
  570: 	     end,
  571:     spawn_link(Server),
  572:     {ok, Socket} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port, [{active, false} | ClientOpts]),
  573:     Result = tls_closed_in_active_once_loop(Socket),
  574:     ssl:close(Socket),
  575:     case Result of
  576: 	ok -> ok;
  577: 	_ -> ct:fail(Result)
  578:     end.
  579: 
  580: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  581: tls_closed_in_active_once() ->
  582:     [{doc, "Test that active once can be used to deliver not only all data"
  583:       " but even the close message, see ERL-1409, in normal operation."
  584:       " This is also test, with slightly different circumstances in"
  585:       " the old tls_closed_in_active_once test"
  586:       " renamed tls_reset_in_active_once"}].
  587: 
  588: tls_closed_in_active_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  589:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  590:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  591:     {_ClientNode, _ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  592:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  593:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(node()),
  594:     Server = fun() ->
  595: 		     {ok, Listen} = gen_tcp:listen(Port, TcpOpts),
  596: 		     {ok, TcpServerSocket} = gen_tcp:accept(Listen),
  597: 		     {ok, ServerSocket} = ssl:handshake(TcpServerSocket, ServerOpts),
  598: 		     lists:foreach(
  599: 		       fun(_) ->
  600: 			       ssl:send(ServerSocket, "some random message\r\n")
  601: 		       end, lists:seq(1, 20)),
  602: 		     ssl:close(ServerSocket)
  603: 	     end,
  604:     spawn_link(Server),
  605:     {ok, Socket} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port, [{active, false} | ClientOpts]),
  606:     Result = tls_closed_in_active_once_loop(Socket),
  607:     ssl:close(Socket),
  608:     case Result of
  609: 	ok -> ok;
  610: 	_ -> ct:fail(Result)
  611:     end.
  612: 
  613: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  614: tls_monitor_listener() ->
  615:     [{doc, "Check that TLS server processes are shutdown when listener socket is closed."
  616:       "Note that individual already established connections may live longer."}].
  617: 
  618: tls_monitor_listener(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  619:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  620:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  621:     Version = ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config),
  622:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  623: 
  624:     Server1 = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  625: 					{from, self()},
  626:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
  627:                                          {options, tls_monitor_listen_opts(Version, ServerOpts)}]),
  628:     Port1 = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server1),
  629: 
  630:     Server2 = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  631: 					{from, self()},
  632:                                          {options, tls_monitor_listen_opts(Version, ServerOpts)}]),
  633:     _Port2 = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server2),
  634: 
  635:     2 = count_children(workers, ssl_listen_tracker_sup),
  636: 
  637:     Sessions = session_info(Version),
  638: 
  639:     true = (Sessions == 2),
  640: 
  641:     Client1 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port1},
  642:                                          {host, Hostname},
  643:                                          {from, self()},
  644:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
  645:                                          {options, tls_monitor_client_opts(Version, ClientOpts)}
  646: 					]),
  647: 
  648:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server1, ok, Client1, ok),
  649:     Monitor = erlang:monitor(process, Server1),
  650:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server1),
  651:     receive
  652:         {'DOWN', Monitor, _, _, _} ->
  653:             ct:sleep(1000)
  654:     end,
  655: 
  656: 
  657:     Sessions1 = session_info(Version),
  658:     true = (Sessions1 == 1),
  659: 
  660:     1 = count_children(workers, ssl_listen_tracker_sup).
  661: 
  662: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  663: tls_tcp_msg() ->
  664:     [{doc,"Test what happens when a tcp tries to connect, i,e. a bad (ssl) packet is sent first"}].
  665: 
  666: tls_tcp_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  667:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  668:     {_, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  669:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}, {active, false}],
  670: 
  671:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server_error([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  672: 						      {from, self()},
  673: 						      {timeout, 5000},
  674: 						      {mfa, {?MODULE, dummy, []}},
  675: 						      {tcp_options, TcpOpts},
  676: 						      {ssl_options, ServerOpts}]),
  677:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  678: 
  679:     {ok, Socket} = gen_tcp:connect(Hostname, Port, [binary, {packet, 0}]),
  680:     ?CT_LOG("connected to Server ~p ~n", [Server]),
  681:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, "<SOME GARBLED NON SSL MESSAGE>"),
  682: 
  683:     receive
  684: 	{tcp_closed, Socket} ->
  685: 	    receive
  686: 		{Server, {error, Error}} ->
  687: 		    ?CT_LOG("Error ~p", [Error])
  688: 	    end
  689:     end.
  690: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  691: tls_tcp_msg_big() ->
  692:     [{doc,"Test what happens when a tcp tries to connect, i,e. a bad big (ssl) packet is sent first"}].
  693: 
  694: tls_tcp_msg_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  695:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  696:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  697:     {_, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  698:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  699: 
  700:     Rand = crypto:strong_rand_bytes(?MAX_CIPHER_TEXT_LENGTH+1),
  701:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server_error([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  702: 						      {from, self()},
  703: 						      {timeout, 5000},
  704: 						      {mfa, {?MODULE, dummy, []}},
  705: 						      {tcp_options, TcpOpts},
  706: 						      {ssl_options, ServerOpts}]),
  707:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  708: 
  709:     {ok, Socket} = gen_tcp:connect(Hostname, Port, [binary, {packet, 0}]),
  710:     ?CT_LOG("connected to Server ~p ~n", [Server]),
  711: 
  712:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, <<?BYTE(0),
  713: 			   ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(1), ?UINT16(?MAX_CIPHER_TEXT_LENGTH), Rand/binary>>),
  714: 
  715:     receive
  716: 	{tcp_closed, Socket} ->
  717: 	    receive
  718: 		{Server, {error, timeout}} ->
  719: 		    ct:fail("hangs");
  720: 		{Server, {error, Error}} ->
  721: 		    ?CT_LOG("Error ~p", [Error]);
  722: 		{'EXIT', Server, _} ->
  723: 		    ok
  724: 	    end
  725:     end.
  726: 
  727: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  728: tls_dont_crash_on_handshake_garbage() ->
  729:     [{doc, "Ensure SSL server worker thows an alert on garbage during handshake "
  730:       "instead of crashing and exposing state to user code"}].
  731: 
  732: tls_dont_crash_on_handshake_garbage(Config) ->
  733:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  734:     Version = ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config),
  735:     {_ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  736:     Ciphers = ssl:filter_cipher_suites(ssl:cipher_suites(all, Version),
  737:                                        [{key_exchange, fun(srp_rsa) -> false;
  738:                                                           (srp_dss) -> false;
  739:                                                           (_) -> true
  740:                                                        end}]),
  741: 
  742: 
  743:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  744:                                         {from, self()},
  745:                                         {mfa, ssl_test_lib, no_result},
  746:                                         {options, [{versions, [Version]}, {ciphers, Ciphers} | ServerOpts]}]),
  747:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  748: 
  749:     {ok, Socket} = gen_tcp:connect(Hostname, Port, [binary, {active, false}]),
  750: 
  751:     %% Send hello and garbage record
  752:     ok = gen_tcp:send(Socket,
  753:                       [<<22, 3,3, 49:16, 1, 45:24, 3,3, % client_hello
  754:                          16#deadbeef:256, % 32 'random' bytes = 256 bits
  755:                          0, 6:16, 0,255, 0,61, 0,57, 1, 0 >>, % some hello values
  756:                        <<22, 3,3, 5:16, 92,64,37,228,209>> % garbage
  757:                       ]),
  758:     %% Send unexpected change_cipher_spec
  759:     ok = gen_tcp:send(Socket, <<20, 3,3, 12:16, 111,40,244,7,137,224,16,109,197,110,249,152>>),
  760:     gen_tcp:close(Socket),
  761:     % Ensure we receive an alert, not sudden disconnect
  762:     case Version of
  763:         'tlsv1.3' ->
  764:             ssl_test_lib:check_server_alert(Server, protocol_version);
  765:         _ ->
  766:             ssl_test_lib:check_server_alert(Server, handshake_failure)
  767:     end.
  768: 
  769: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  770: tls_tcp_error_propagation_in_active_mode() ->
  771:     [{doc,"Test that process receives {ssl_error, Socket, closed} when tcp error ocurres"}].
  772: tls_tcp_error_propagation_in_active_mode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  773:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  774:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  775: 
  776:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  777: 
  778:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  779: 					 {from, self()},
  780: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  781: 					 {options, ServerOpts}]),
  782:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  783:     {Client, #sslsocket{pid=[Pid|_]} = SslSocket} = ssl_test_lib:start_client([return_socket,
  784:                                                                                {node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  785:                                                                                {host, Hostname},
  786:                                                                                {from, self()},
  787:                                                                                {mfa, {?MODULE, receive_msg, []}},
  788:                                                                                {options, ClientOpts}]),
  789: 
  790:     {status, _, _, StatusInfo} = sys:get_status(Pid),
  791:     [_, _,_, _, Prop] = StatusInfo,
  792:     State = ssl_test_lib:state(Prop),
  793:     StaticEnv = element(2, State),
  794:     Socket = element(11, StaticEnv),
  795:     %% Fake tcp error
  796:     Pid ! {tcp_error, Socket, etimedout},
  797: 
  798:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Client, {ssl_closed, SslSocket}).
  799: 
  800: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  801: tls_reject_warning_alert_in_initial_hs() ->
  802:     [{doc,"Test sending warning ALERT instead of client hello"}].
  803: tls_reject_warning_alert_in_initial_hs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  804:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  805:     {_Clientnode, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  806:     {Major, Minor} = case ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config, tuple) of
  807:                          ?TLS_1_3 ->
  808:                              ?TLS_1_2;
  809:                          Other ->
  810:                              Other
  811:                      end,
  812:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  813: 					 {from, self()},
  814: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  815: 					 {options, [{versions, [ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config)]} | ServerOpts]}]),
  816:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  817:     {ok, Socket}  = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", Port, [{active, false}, binary]),
  818:     NoRenegotiateAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), ?UINT16(2), ?BYTE(?WARNING), ?BYTE(?NO_RENEGOTIATION)>>,
  819:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, NoRenegotiateAlert),
  820:     UnexpectedMsgAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), ?UINT16(2), ?BYTE(?FATAL), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  821:     {ok, UnexpectedMsgAlert} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 7),
  822:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0).
  823: 
  824: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  825: tls_reject_fake_warning_alert_in_initial_hs() ->
  826:     [{doc,"Test sending 'fake' warning ALERT covers different function clause pre TLS-1.3"}].
  827: tls_reject_fake_warning_alert_in_initial_hs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  828:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  829:     {_ClientNode, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  830:     {Major, Minor} = case ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config, tuple) of
  831:                          ?TLS_1_3 ->
  832:                              ?TLS_1_2;
  833:                          Other ->
  834:                              Other
  835:                      end,
  836:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  837: 					 {from, self()},
  838: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  839: 					 {options, [{versions, [ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config)]} | ServerOpts]}]),
  840:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  841:     {ok, Socket}  = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", Port, [{active, false}, binary]),
  842:     NoRenegotiateAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), ?UINT16(2), ?BYTE(?WARNING), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  843:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, NoRenegotiateAlert),
  844:     UnexpectedMsgAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), ?UINT16(2), ?BYTE(?FATAL), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  845:     {ok, UnexpectedMsgAlert} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 7),
  846:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0).
  847: 
  848: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  849: tls_app_data_in_initial_hs_state() ->
  850:      [{doc,"Test sending application data instead of initial client hello. In TLS-1.3 application data can be sent",
  851:        "in first round trip but not before client hello."}].
  852: tls_app_data_in_initial_hs_state(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  853:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  854:     {_ClientNode, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  855:     Version = ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config, tuple),
  856:     {Major, Minor} = case Version of
  857:                          ?TLS_1_3 ->
  858:                              ?TLS_1_2;
  859:                          Other ->
  860:                              Other
  861:                      end,
  862:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  863: 					 {from, self()},
  864: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  865: 					 {options, [{versions, [ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config)]} | ServerOpts]}]),
  866:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  867:     {ok, Socket}  = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", Port, [{active, false}, binary]),
  868:     AppData = case Version of
  869:                   ?TLS_1_3 ->
  870:                       <<?BYTE(?APPLICATION_DATA), ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(3), ?UINT16(4), ?BYTE($F), 
  871:                         ?BYTE($O), ?BYTE($O), ?BYTE(?APPLICATION_DATA)>>;
  872:                   _ ->
  873:                      <<?BYTE(?APPLICATION_DATA), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), 
  874:                        ?UINT16(3), ?BYTE($F), ?BYTE($O), ?BYTE($O)>>
  875:               end,
  876:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, AppData),
  877:     UnexpectedMsgAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), ?UINT16(2), 
  878:                            ?BYTE(?FATAL), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  879:     {ok, UnexpectedMsgAlert} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 7),
  880:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0).
  881: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  882: tls_13_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg() ->
  883:      [{doc,"change_cipher_spec messages can be sent in TLS-1.3 middlebox_comp_mode, but can not be sent as first msg"}].
  884: tls_13_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  885:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  886:     {_ClientNode, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  887:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  888:                                          {from, self()},
  889:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  890:                                          {options, [{versions, [ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config)]} | ServerOpts]}]),
  891:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  892:     {ok, Socket}  = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", Port, [{active, false}, binary]),
  893:     ChangeCipherSpec = <<?BYTE(?CHANGE_CIPHER_SPEC), ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(3),
  894:                          ?UINT16(1), ?BYTE(?CHANGE_CIPHER_SPEC_PROTO)>>,
  895:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, ChangeCipherSpec),
  896:     UnexpectedMsgAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(3), ?UINT16(2),
  897:                            ?BYTE(?FATAL), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  898:     {ok, UnexpectedMsgAlert} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 7),
  899:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0).
  900: 
  901: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  902: tls_13_middlebox_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg() ->
  903:      [{doc,"change_cipher_spec messages can be sent in TLS-1.3 middlebox_comp_mode, but can not be sent as first msg"}].
  904: tls_13_middlebox_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  905:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  906:     {_ClientNode, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  907:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  908:                                          {from, self()},
  909:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  910:                                          {options, [{middlebox_comp_mode, false},
  911:                                                     {versions, [ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config)]}
  912:                                                    | ServerOpts]}]),
  913:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  914:     {ok, Socket}  = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", Port, [{active, false}, binary]),
  915:     ChangeCipherSpec = <<?BYTE(?CHANGE_CIPHER_SPEC), ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(3),
  916:                          ?UINT16(1), ?BYTE(?CHANGE_CIPHER_SPEC_PROTO)>>,
  917:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, ChangeCipherSpec),
  918:     UnexpectedMsgAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(3), ?UINT16(2),
  919:                            ?BYTE(?FATAL), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  920:     {ok, UnexpectedMsgAlert} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 7),
  921:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0).
  922: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  923: peername() ->
  924:     [{doc,"Test API function peername/1"}].
  925: 
  926: peername(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  927:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  928:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  929:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  930:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  931: 					{from, self()},
  932: 			   {mfa, {ssl, peername, []}},
  933: 			   {options, ServerOpts}]),
  934:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  935:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  936: 					{host, Hostname},
  937: 					{from, self()},
  938: 					{mfa, {ssl, peername, []}},
  939: 					{options, [{port, 0} | ClientOpts]}]),
  940: 
  941:     ClientPort = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Client),
  942:     ServerIp = ssl_test_lib:node_to_hostip(ServerNode, server),
  943:     ClientIp = ssl_test_lib:node_to_hostip(ClientNode, client),
  944:     ServerMsg = {ok, {ClientIp, ClientPort}},
  945:     ClientMsg = {ok, {ServerIp, Port}},
  946: 
  947:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  948: 
  949:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ServerMsg, Client, ClientMsg),
  950: 
  951:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  952:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  953: 
  954: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  955: sockname() ->
  956:     [{doc,"Test API function sockname/1"}].
  957: sockname(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  958:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  959:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  960:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  961:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  962: 					{from, self()},
  963: 			   {mfa, {ssl, sockname, []}},
  964: 			   {options, ServerOpts}]),
  965:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  966:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  967: 					{host, Hostname},
  968:                                         {from, self()},
  969:                                         {mfa, {ssl, sockname, []}},
  970:                                         {options, [{port, 0} | ClientOpts]}]),
  971: 
  972:     ClientPort = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Client),
  973:     ServerIp = ssl_test_lib:node_to_hostip(ServerNode, server),
  974:     ClientIp = ssl_test_lib:node_to_hostip(ClientNode, client),
  975:     ServerMsg = {ok, {ServerIp, Port}},
  976:     ClientMsg = {ok, {ClientIp, ClientPort}},
  977: 
  978:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  979: 
  980:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ServerMsg, Client, ClientMsg),
  981: 
  982:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  983:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  984: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  985: tls_server_handshake_timeout() ->
  986:     [{doc,"Test server handshake timeout"}].
  987: 
  988: tls_server_handshake_timeout(Config) ->
  989:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  990:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  991:     {_, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  992:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  993: 					{from, self()},
  994: 					{timeout, 5000},
  995: 					{mfa, {ssl_test_lib,
  996: 					       no_result_msg, []}},
  997: 					{options, ServerOpts}]),
  998:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  999:     {ok, CSocket} = gen_tcp:connect(Hostname, Port, [binary, {active, true}]),
 1000: 
 1001:     receive
 1002: 	{tcp_closed, CSocket} ->
 1003: 	    ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, {error, timeout}),
 1004: 	    receive
 1005: 		{'EXIT', Server, _} ->
 1006: 		    %% Make sure supervisor had time to react on process exit
 1007: 		    %% Could we come up with a better solution to this?
 1008: 		    ct:sleep(500),
 1009: 		    [] = supervisor:which_children(tls_connection_sup)
 1010: 	    end
 1011:     end.
 1012: 
 1013: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1014: transport_close() ->
 1015:     [{doc, "Test what happens if socket is closed on TCP level after a while of normal operation"}].
 1016: transport_close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1017:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
 1018:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1019:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1020:     Server =
 1021: 	ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1022: 				   {from, self()},
 1023: 				   {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result, []}},
 1024: 				   {options,  [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
 1025:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1026:     {ok, TcpS} = rpc:call(ClientNode, gen_tcp, connect,
 1027: 			  [Hostname,Port,[binary, {active, false}]]),
 1028:     {ok, SslS} = rpc:call(ClientNode, ssl, connect,
 1029: 			  [TcpS,[{active, false}|ClientOpts]]),
 1030: 
 1031:     ?CT_LOG("Server ~p ~n", [Server]),
 1032:     ok = ssl:send(SslS, "Hello world"),
 1033:     {ok,<<"Hello world">>} = ssl:recv(SslS, 11),
 1034:     gen_tcp:close(TcpS),
 1035:     {error, _} = ssl:send(SslS, "Hello world").
 1036: 
 1037: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1038: transport_close_in_inital_hello() ->
 1039:     [{doc, "Test what happens if server dies after calling transport_accept but before initiating handshake."}].
 1040: transport_close_in_inital_hello(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1041:     _ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
 1042:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1043:     {_, _, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1044:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1045: 
 1046:     Testcase = self(),
 1047: 
 1048:     Acceptor = spawn_link(fun() ->
 1049:                                   {ok, Listen} = ssl:listen(0, ServerOpts),
 1050:                                   {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(Listen),
 1051:                                   Testcase ! {port, Port},
 1052:                                   {ok, _Accept} = ssl:transport_accept(Listen),
 1053:                                   receive
 1054:                                       die -> ok
 1055:                                   end
 1056:                           end),
 1057:     Port =  receive
 1058:                 {port, Port0} ->
 1059:                     Port0
 1060:             end,
 1061: 
 1062:     Connector = spawn_link(fun() ->
 1063:                                    {ok, _} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port,
 1064:                                                          [{verify, verify_none}],
 1065:                                                          infinity
 1066:                                                         )
 1067:                            end),
 1068: 
 1069: 
 1070:     Sup = (whereis(tls_connection_sup)),
 1071: 
 1072:     check_connection_processes(Sup, 2),
 1073: 
 1074:     Acceptor ! die,
 1075: 
 1076:     receive
 1077:          {'EXIT', Acceptor, _} ->
 1078:             ok
 1079:     end,
 1080:     receive
 1081:         {'EXIT', Connector, _} ->
 1082:             ok
 1083:      end,
 1084:     check_connection_processes(Sup, 0).
 1085: 
 1086: check_connection_processes(Sup, N) ->
 1087:     check_connection_processes(Sup, N, 5).
 1088: 
 1089: check_connection_processes(Sup, N, 0) ->
 1090:     N = count_children(supervisors, Sup);
 1091: check_connection_processes(Sup, N, M) ->
 1092:     case count_children(supervisors, Sup) of
 1093:         N ->
 1094:             ok;
 1095:         _ ->
 1096:             ct:sleep(500),
 1097:             check_connection_processes(Sup, N, M-1)
 1098:     end.
 1099: 
 1100: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1101: emulated_options() ->
 1102:     [{doc,"Test API function getopts/2 and setopts/2"}].
 1103: 
 1104: emulated_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1105:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
 1106:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1107:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1108:     Values = [{mode, list}, {packet, 0}, {header, 0},
 1109: 		      {active, true}],
 1110:     %% Shall be the reverse order of Values!
 1111:     Options = [active, header, packet, mode],
 1112: 
 1113:     NewValues = [{mode, binary}, {active, once}],
 1114:     %% Shall be the reverse order of NewValues!
 1115:     NewOptions = [active, mode],
 1116: 
 1117:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1118: 					{from, self()},
 1119: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_socket_options_result,
 1120: 				  [Options, Values, NewOptions, NewValues]}},
 1121: 			   {options, ServerOpts}]),
 1122:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1123:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1124: 					{host, Hostname},
 1125: 			   {from, self()},
 1126: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_socket_options_result,
 1127: 				  [Options, Values, NewOptions, NewValues]}},
 1128: 			   {options, ClientOpts}]),
 1129: 
 1130:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
 1131: 
 1132:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
 1133: 
 1134:     {ok, Listen} = ssl:listen(0, ServerOpts),
 1135:     {ok,[{mode,list}]} = ssl:getopts(Listen, [mode]),
 1136:     ok = ssl:setopts(Listen, [{mode, binary}]),
 1137:     {ok,[{mode, binary}]} = ssl:getopts(Listen, [mode]),
 1138:     {ok,[{recbuf, _}]} = ssl:getopts(Listen, [recbuf]),
 1139:     ssl:close(Listen).
 1140: accept_pool() ->
 1141:     [{doc,"Test having an accept pool."}].
 1142: accept_pool(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1143:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
 1144:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1145: 
 1146:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1147:     Server0 = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1148: 					{from, self()},
 1149: 					{accepters, 3},
 1150: 					{mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
 1151: 					{options, ServerOpts}]),
 1152:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server0),
 1153:     [Server1, Server2] = ssl_test_lib:accepters(2),
 1154: 
 1155:     Client0 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1156: 					 {host, Hostname},
 1157: 					 {from, self()},
 1158: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
 1159: 					 {options, ClientOpts}
 1160: 					]),
 1161: 
 1162:     Client1 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1163: 					 {host, Hostname},
 1164: 					 {from, self()},
 1165: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
 1166: 					 {options, ClientOpts}
 1167: 					]),
 1168: 
 1169:     Client2 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1170: 					 {host, Hostname},
 1171: 					 {from, self()},
 1172: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
 1173: 					 {options, ClientOpts}
 1174: 					]),
 1175: 
 1176:     ssl_test_lib:check_ok([Server0, Server1, Server2, Client0, Client1, Client2]),
 1177: 
 1178:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server0),
 1179:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server1),
 1180:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server2),
 1181:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client0),
 1182:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client1),
 1183:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client2).
 1184:

 1224: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1225: tls_password_correct() ->
 1226:     [{doc, "Test that connection is possible with a correct password"}].
 1227: tls_password_correct(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1228:     F = fun (P) ->
 1229:                 ProtectedClientOpts = ?config(client_protected_rsa_opts, Config),
 1230:                 ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1231: 
 1232:                 {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1233:                 Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1234:                                                     {from, self()},
 1235:                                                     {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result, []}},
 1236:                                                     {options, [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
 1237:                 Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1238:                 Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1239:                                                     {host, Hostname},
 1240:                                                     {from, self()},
 1241:                                                     {mfa,
 1242:                                                      {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result, []}},
 1243:                                                     {options,
 1244:                                                      [{verify, verify_none},
 1245:                                                       {active, false},
 1246:                                                       {password, P} | ProtectedClientOpts]}]),
 1247:                 ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
 1248:                 ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
 1249:                 ssl_test_lib:close(Client)
 1250:         end,
 1251:     F(?CORRECT_PASSWORD),
 1252:     F(fun() -> ?CORRECT_PASSWORD end).
 1253: 
 1254: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1255: tls_password_incorrect() ->
 1256:     [{doc, "Test that connection is not possible with wrong password"}].
 1257: tls_password_incorrect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1258:     F = fun (P) ->
 1259:                 ProtectedClientOpts = ?config(client_protected_rsa_opts, Config),
 1260:                 ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1261: 
 1262:                 {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1263:                 Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server_error([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1264:                                                           {from, self()},
 1265:                                                           {mfa, ssl_test_lib, no_result},
 1266:                                                           {options, [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
 1267:                 Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1268:                 Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client_error([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1269:                                                           {host, Hostname},
 1270:                                                           {from, self()},
 1271:                                                           {mfa, ssl_test_lib, no_result},
 1272:                                                           {options,
 1273:                                                            [{active, false},
 1274:                                                             {verify, verify_none},
 1275:                                                             {password, P} | ProtectedClientOpts]}]),
 1276:                 Results = ssl_test_lib:get_result([Server, Client]),
 1277:                 Pred = fun({Pid, {error, closed}}) ->
 1278:                                Server == Pid;
 1279:                           ({Pid, {error, {options, {keyfile, _, {error, _}}}}}) ->
 1280:                                Client == Pid;
 1281:                           (_) -> false
 1282:                        end,
 1283:                 true = lists:all(Pred, Results)
 1284:         end,
 1285:     F(?INCORRECT_PASSWORD),
 1286:     F(fun() -> ?INCORRECT_PASSWORD end).
 1287: 
 1288: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1289: tls_password_badarg() ->
 1290:     [{doc, "Test that connection is not possible with badarg password"}].
 1291: tls_password_badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1292:     F = fun (P, ServerError, ClientError) ->
 1293:                 ProtectedClientOpts = ?config(client_protected_rsa_opts, Config),
 1294:                 ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1295:                 {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1296:                 Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server_error([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1297:                                                           {from, self()},
 1298:                                                           {mfa, ssl_test_lib, no_result},
 1299:                                                           {timeout, 100},
 1300:                                                           {options, [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
 1301:                 Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1302:                 Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client_error([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1303:                                                           {host, Hostname},
 1304:                                                           {from, self()},
 1305:                                                           {mfa, ssl_test_lib, no_result},
 1306:                                                           {options,
 1307:                                                            [{active, false},
 1308:                                                             {verify, verify_none},
 1309:                                                             {password, P} | ProtectedClientOpts]}]),
 1310:                 ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ServerError, Client, ClientError)
 1311:         end,
 1312:     %% {options error comes from ssl app
 1313:     F(?BADARG_PASSWORD, {error, timeout},
 1314:       {error, {options, {password, ?BADARG_PASSWORD}}}),
 1315:     %% {keyfile, badarg} error comes from crypto:macN, also handhsake is initiated
 1316:     %% so different server error is observed
 1317:     F(fun() -> ?BADARG_PASSWORD end, {error, closed},
 1318:       {error, {keyfile,badarg}}).
 1319: 
 1320: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1321: signature_algs() ->
 1322:     [{doc, "Check that listing of signature algorithms for different version and configure combinations"}].
 1323: signature_algs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1324:     true = [] =/= [Alg || Alg <- ssl:signature_algs(default, 'tlsv1.3'), is_tuple(Alg)],
 1325:     true = [] == [Alg || Alg <- ssl:signature_algs(exclusive, 'tlsv1.3'), is_tuple(Alg)],
 1326:     true = ssl:signature_algs(exclusive, 'tlsv1.3') =/=  ssl:signature_algs(exclusive, 'tlsv1.2'),
 1327:     true = length(ssl:signature_algs(defalt, 'tlsv1.2')) <
 1328:         length(ssl:signature_algs(all, 'tlsv1.2')),
 1329:     TLS_1_3_All = ssl:signature_algs(all, 'tlsv1.3'),
 1330:     true = lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha512, TLS_1_3_All) andalso (not lists:member({sha512, rsa}, TLS_1_3_All)),
 1331:     true = lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha384, TLS_1_3_All) andalso (not lists:member({sha384, rsa}, TLS_1_3_All)),
 1332:     true = lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha256, TLS_1_3_All) andalso (not lists:member({sha256, rsa}, TLS_1_3_All)),
 1333:     TLS_1_2_All = ssl:signature_algs(all, 'tlsv1.2'),
 1334:     true = (not lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha512, TLS_1_2_All)) andalso lists:member({sha512, rsa}, TLS_1_2_All),
 1335:     true = (not lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha384, TLS_1_2_All)) andalso lists:member({sha384, rsa}, TLS_1_2_All),
 1336:     true = (not lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha256, TLS_1_2_All)) andalso lists:member({sha256, rsa}, TLS_1_2_All).
 1337: 
 1338: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1339: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
 1340: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1341: 
 1342: upgrade_result(Socket) ->
 1343:     ssl:setopts(Socket, [{active, true}]),
 1344:     ok = ssl:send(Socket, "Hello world"),
 1345:     %% Make sure binary is inherited from tcp socket and that we do
 1346:     %% not get the list default!
 1347:     <<"Hello world">> =  ssl_test_lib:active_recv(Socket, length("Hello world")),
 1348:     ok.
 1349: 
 1350: upgrade_result_new_opts(Socket) ->
 1351:     ssl:setopts(Socket, [{active, true}]),
 1352:     ok = ssl:send(Socket, "Hello world"),
 1353:     %% Make sure list option set in ssl:connect/handshake overrides
 1354:     %% previous gen_tcp socket option that was set to binary.
 1355:     "Hello world" =  ssl_test_lib:active_recv(Socket, length("Hello world")),
 1356:     ok.
 1357: 
 1358: tls_downgrade_result(Socket, Pid) ->
 1359:     ok = ssl_test_lib:send_recv_result(Socket),
 1360:     Pid ! {self(), ready},
 1361:     receive
 1362:         go ->
 1363:             ok
 1364:     end,
 1365:     case ssl:close(Socket, {self(), 10000})  of
 1366: 	{ok, TCPSocket} ->
 1367:             inet:setopts(TCPSocket, [{active, true}]),
 1368: 	    gen_tcp:send(TCPSocket, "Downgraded"),
 1369:             <<"Downgraded">> = active_tcp_recv(TCPSocket, length("Downgraded")),
 1370:             ok;
 1371: 	{ok, TCPSocket, Bin} ->
 1372: 	    gen_tcp:send(TCPSocket, "Downgraded"),
 1373:             <<"Downgraded">> = Bin,
 1374:             ok;
 1375: 	{error, timeout} ->
 1376: 	    ct:comment("Timed out, downgrade aborted"),
 1377: 	    ok;
 1378: 	Fail ->
 1379:             ct:fail(Fail)
 1380:     end.
 1381: 
 1382: tls_shutdown_result(Socket, server) ->
 1383:     ok = ssl:send(Socket, "Hej"),
 1384:     ok = ssl:shutdown(Socket, write),
 1385:     {ok, "Hej hopp"} = ssl:recv(Socket, 8),
 1386:     ok;
 1387: 
 1388: tls_shutdown_result(Socket, client) ->
 1389:     ok = ssl:send(Socket, "Hej hopp"),
 1390:     ok = ssl:shutdown(Socket, write),
 1391:     {ok, "Hej"} = ssl:recv(Socket, 3),
 1392:     ok.
 1393: 
 1394: tls_shutdown_write_result(Socket, server) ->
 1395:     ct:sleep(?SLEEP),
 1396:     ssl:shutdown(Socket, write);
 1397: tls_shutdown_write_result(Socket, client) ->
 1398:     ssl:recv(Socket, 0).
 1399: 
 1400: tls_shutdown_both_result(Socket, server) ->
 1401:     ct:sleep(?SLEEP),
 1402:     ssl:shutdown(Socket, read_write);
 1403: tls_shutdown_both_result(Socket, client) ->
 1404:     ssl:recv(Socket, 0).
 1405: 
 1406: tls_closed_in_active_once_loop(Socket) ->
 1407:     case ssl:setopts(Socket, [{active, once}]) of
 1408:         ok ->
 1409:             receive
 1410:                 {ssl, Socket, _} ->
 1411:                     tls_closed_in_active_once_loop(Socket);
 1412:                 {ssl_closed, Socket} ->
 1413:                     ok
 1414:             end;
 1415:         {error, closed} ->
 1416:             {error, ssl_setopt_failed}
 1417:     end.
 1418: 
 1419: receive_msg(_) ->
 1420:     receive
 1421: 	Msg ->
 1422: 	   Msg
 1423:     end.
 1424: 
 1425: tls_socket_options_result(Socket, Options, DefaultValues, NewOptions, NewValues) ->
 1426:     %% Test get/set emulated opts
 1427:     {ok, DefaultValues} = ssl:getopts(Socket, Options),
 1428:     ssl:setopts(Socket, NewValues),
 1429:     {ok, NewValues} = ssl:getopts(Socket, NewOptions),
 1430:     %% Test get/set inet opts
 1431:     {ok,[{nodelay,false}]} = ssl:getopts(Socket, [nodelay]),
 1432:     ssl:setopts(Socket, [{nodelay, true}]),
 1433:     {ok,[{nodelay, true}]} = ssl:getopts(Socket, [nodelay]),
 1434:     {ok, All} = ssl:getopts(Socket, []),
 1435:     ?CT_LOG("All opts ~p~n", [All]),
 1436:     ok.
 1437: 
 1438: active_tcp_recv(Socket, N) ->
 1439:     active_tcp_recv(Socket, N, []).
 1440: 
 1441: active_tcp_recv(_Socket, 0, Acc) ->
 1442:     Acc;
 1443: active_tcp_recv(Socket, N, Acc) ->
 1444:     receive
 1445: 	{tcp, Socket, Bytes} ->
 1446:             active_tcp_recv(Socket, N-size(Bytes),  Acc ++ Bytes)
 1447:     end.
 1448: 
 1449: tls_monitor_listen_opts('tlsv1.3', Opts) ->
 1450:     [{session_tickets, stateful} | Opts];
 1451: tls_monitor_listen_opts(_, Opts) ->
 1452:     Opts.
 1453: 
 1454: tls_monitor_client_opts('tlsv1.3', Opts) ->
 1455:     [{session_tickets, auto} | Opts];
 1456: tls_monitor_client_opts(_, Opts) ->
 1457:     Opts.
 1458: 
 1459: session_info('tlsv1.3') ->
 1460:     count_children(workers, tls_server_session_ticket_sup);
 1461: session_info(_) ->
 1462:     count_children(workers, ssl_server_session_cache_sup).
 1463: 
 1464: count_children(ChildType, SupRef) ->
 1465:     proplists:get_value(ChildType, supervisor:count_children(SupRef)).
 1466: 
 1467: 
 1468: new_versions('tlsv1.3') ->
 1469:     ['tlsv1.2'];
 1470: new_versions('tlsv1.2') ->
 1471:     ['tlsv1.1'];
 1472: new_versions('tlsv1.1') ->
 1473:     ['tlsv1'];
 1474: new_versions('tlsv1') ->
 1475:     ['tlsv1'].
